abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is likely;
            institutional development impact is substantial; Bank
            performance is satisfactory; and Borrower performance is
            satisfactory. These are among the key lessons cited: 1)
            Where there is a potential for procurement problems, it is
            important to have a high level of project preparation and
            readiness at entry. 2) During times of financial crisis or
            political change, projects should be designed with a view
            toward maximum flexibility, and the potential for rapid
            restructuring as the need arises. 3) There are advantages in
            cost effectiveness and efficiency when several similar
            projects are funded concurrently and managed as a single
            program. 4) Baseline data should always be collected,
            documented in the Project Appraisal Document, and agreed
            upon during project preparation. 5) Systematic monitoring
            and evaluation is critical in a project with widely
            dispersed activities and sites. 6) The establishment of a
            strongly staffed and well managed project implementation
            unit are key factors for successful implementation.7)
            Project personnel from provincial and district agencies
            should become more familiar with Bank guidelines and
            documentation requirements. 8) Geographical targeting of
            services should be done on the basis of poverty. Estimates
            should be made down to the village level. There should be a
            pre-commitment to update the "map" each
            year--thereby overcoming the static nature of most poverty
            map schemes 9) School mapping can be useful to education
            agencies. 10) When a project has widely disbursed project
            sites, local administrators, coordinators and teachers
            should be more fully briefed regarding the advantages of
            participating as well as their responsibilities. 11) When
            technical consultants are selected and contracted as
            individuals, rather than as teams (organizations), there is
            a strong possibility that they may not form a cohesive
            working unit. This lack of cohesion may cause delays in
            construction, lack of architectural control over the
            project, and a lack of articulation between various plans
            and specifications 12) Using contract teachers may address
            the temporary teacher shortage and introduce increased
            flexibility into the civil service.
